009
010package imagingbook.common.regions;
011
012import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019
020
021/**
022 * <p>
023 * This class represents a closed contour as a sequence of pixel coordinates. It
024 * implements the {@link Comparable} interface for sorting contours by length.
025 * It supports iteration over the points along the contour, e.g., by
026 * </p>
027 * <pre>
028 * Contour C = ...;
029 * for (Point p : C) {
030 *    // process p ...
031 * }
032 * </pre>
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2020/12/21
036 */
037public class Contour implements Comparable<Contour>, Iterable<Pnt2d> {
038        
039        static private int INITIAL_SIZE = 50;
040        
041        private final int label;
042        private final List<Pnt2d> points;
043        
044        /**
045         * Creates a new (empty) contour with the given region label.
046         * @param label the region label for this contour.
047         */
048        public Contour (int label) {
049                this.label = label;
050                points = new ArrayList<Pnt2d>(INITIAL_SIZE);
051        }
052        
053        public void addPoint (Pnt2d p) {
054                points.add(p);
055        }
056        
057        //--------------------- retrieve contour points -------
058        
059        /**
060         * Get the list of contour points.
061         * @return a reference to the internal list of contour points.
062         */
063        public List<Pnt2d> getPointList() {
064                return points;
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Get the contour points as an array.
069         * @return a new array of contour points.
070         */
071        public Pnt2d[] getPointArray() {
072                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
073        }
074                
075        //--------------------- contour statistics ------------
076        
077        /**
078         * Get the length of the contour.
079         * @return the number of points on the contour.
080         */
081        public int getLength() {
082                return points.size();
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Get the region label associated with this contour.
087         * @return the region label of the contour.
088         */
089        public int getLabel() {
090                return label;
091        }
092        
093        //--------------------- debug methods ------------------
094        
095        @Override
096        public String toString(){
097                return
098                        "Contour " + label + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
099        }
100        
101        /**
102         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
103         * @return the polygon.
104         */
105        public Path2D getPolygonPath() {
106                return getPolygonPath(0.0, 0.0);
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
111         * An offset can be specified for shifting the contour positions
112         * to pixel centers (by passing 0.5, 0.5).
113         * 
114         * @param xOffset the horizontal offset.
115         * @param yOffset the vertical offset.
116         * @return a polygon.
117         */
118        public Path2D getPolygonPath(double xOffset, double yOffset) {
119                Path2D path = new Path2D.Float();
120                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
121                if (pnts.length > 1) {
122                        path.moveTo(pnts[0].getX() + xOffset, pnts[0].getY() + yOffset);
123                        for (int i = 1; i < pnts.length; i++) {
124                                path.lineTo(pnts[i].getX() + xOffset,  pnts[i].getY() + yOffset);
125                        }
126                        path.closePath();
127                }
128                else {  // special case: mark a single pixel region "X"
129                        double x = pnts[0].getX();
130                        double y = pnts[0].getY();
131                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
132                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
133                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
134                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
135                }
136                return path;
137        }
138        
139        /**
140         * Returns the number of successive duplicates in this contour.
141         * The result should be zero.
142         * @return as described.
143         */
144        public int countDuplicatePoints() {
145                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
146                if (pnts.length <= 1) {
147                        return 0;
148                }
149                int cnt = 0;
150                for (int i = 0; i < pnts.length; i++) {
151                        int j = (i + 1) % pnts.length;
152                        if (pnts[i].getX() == pnts[j].getX() && pnts[i].getY() == pnts[j].getY()) {
153                                cnt++;
154                        }
155                }
156                return cnt;
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Checks if this contour is closed w.r.t. the specified
161         * {@link NeighborhoodType2D}, i.e., if the last and the first
162         * contour point are "connected".
163         * 
164         * @param nht the (@link NeighborhoodType}.
165         * @return true if the contour is closed.
166         */
167        public boolean isClosed(NeighborhoodType2D nht) {
168                Pnt2d[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
169                if (pnts.length < 2) 
170                        return true;
171                Pnt2d p1 = pnts[pnts.length - 1];
172                Pnt2d p2 = pnts[0];
173                double d2 = p1.distanceSq(p2);  // N4: max 1, N8: max 2
174                //System.out.println(nht + " dist=" + d2);
175                
176                if (nht == NeighborhoodType2D.N4 && d2 <= 1)
177                        return true;
178                if (nht == NeighborhoodType2D.N8 && d2 <= 2)
179                        return true;
180                return false;
181        }
182
183                
184        // Compare method for sorting contours by length (longer contours at front)
185        @Override
186        public int compareTo(Contour other) {
187                //return other.points.size() - this.points.size();
188                return Integer.compare(other.points.size(), this.points.size());
189        }
190
191        @Override
192        public Iterator<Pnt2d> iterator() {
193                return points.iterator();
194        }
195        
196        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
197        
198        public static class Outer extends Contour {
199                public Outer(int label) {
200                        super(label);
201                }
202                
203                @Override
204                public String toString(){
205                        return
206                                "Contour.Outer " + this.getLabel() + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
207                }
208        }
209        
210        public static class Inner extends Contour {
211                public Inner(int label) {
212                        super(label);
213                }
214                
215                @Override
216                public String toString(){
217                        return
218                                "Contour.Inner " + this.getLabel() + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
219                }
220        }
221        
222
223}
